newsitem.title: GERMANY: DASA in deal to make truck radar system.
newsitem.headline: DASA in deal to make truck radar system.

text.p: Daimler-Benz Aerospace said on Wednesday it had signed a cooperation deal with VDO Adolf Schindler AG to build distance and speed regulation devices for commercial vehicles.
DASA, a unit of German industrial group Daimler-Benz AG, said the first radar system should be available in 1998 and a mid-term sales goal has been set at about 50 million marks ($30.4 million).

The first phase of development calls for DASA to develop a radar system with equipment from VDO, with the aim to create a device that would cost about the same as a "good car radio," according to DASA.
